50.0: Magnifies. And, through this, "I will praise you amidst the nations" (Psalm 18:50), for I shall recount, saying, "Know that Adonai magdil ["magnifies"] salvations--that is to say--performs great [acts of] salvation for God's king and not as compensation but amidst lovingkindness."
50.1: And to his seed. And so shall be done for his seed for eternity.

3.0: I will sit: When I shall sit in the house of the Lord it will be good for me
3.1: To gaze: To see the pleasantness of the Torah of the Lord
3.2: And to visit: To investigate the commandments of the Lord in his palace.

1.0: "All ye people" - because everybody needs this lesson.

5.0: Nishtachaveh- this is lying the entire body on the ground
5.1: v'Nichr'ah- this is the bending of the head and part of the body. Nivrechah- this is the bending of the knees down to the earth.

3.0: "He has made a memorial for His wonderful works" - As it is written with regards to the Manna "take a container... and place it...for safe keeping so that it will be a memorial"
1. You are like sharp arrows in the warrior's hands, because he kills with them from a distance. So too you, who are speaking lashon hara and you will kill the one who is standing at a distance.
3.1: 2. You are like coals made from rotem (juniper) wood, because although they seem to be extinguished on the outside, they are still burning on the inside. So too you, who [externally] speak smoothly to a person, but privately you are speaking lashon hara about him.

19.0: "Those who fear G-d" - the righteous among the gentiles.

4.0: 1. Look. When I look right and left and see whether there is anyone who will recognize me, but there is none to recognize me: to have me in mind for anything good before Saul.
4.1: 2. Hope is gone. I have no one to whom I can flee for help.
